name: Oven Roast Pork

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220C, fan forced. Boil a jug of water, place the pork on a wire rack in the sink and slowly pour the water over the pork.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep pork

recipeInstructions.text: Leave the pork in the sink to dry out the skin while you cut up your veg and place them into the baking tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut veg

recipeInstructions.text: In a pot, put 2 cups of water and bring to a boil and put the fennel, chicken stock, chili powder and paprika into the water for a minute. Strain into the tray over the veges. Add extra water if required to bring it just below the veg.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Pat pork dry with paper towels. Rub salt and olive oil into the pork and place it into the tray ontop of the veg.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep tray

recipeInstructions.text: Cook at 220C for about 40 minutes or until the crackling has crackled. Reduce to 160C fan forced for a futher 1h and 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Pork is ready when the thickest part reads 65C. When removing the pork, put the tray onto the stove top and taste the juice for seasoning. Serve and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve!

notes: You don't have to use all the veg, you can add or remove as desired. I also love it with broccoli or cauliflower as the tips soak up all the lovely juices!
